ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:0.5_0: 14. The training rule on six years
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.2_0: At that time monks were having blankets made every year.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.3_0: They kept on begging and asking,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.6_0: People then complained and criticized those nuns,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.7_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics have blankets made every year, begging and asking,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.9_0: But what are the five blankets that falls under?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.10_0: But these Sakyan ascetics have blankets made every year, begging and asking,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.11_0: ‘Give wool; give wool; we need wool.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.12_0: The monks heard those people complaining,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.13_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.14_0: “How can those monks act like this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.15_0: ‘Give wool; give wool; we need wool.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.16_0: After criticizing those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. He had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.17_0: “Is it true, monks, that some monks are acting like this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.18_0: that woolen reeds! You need wool; we need wool’?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.21_0: “How can those foolish men have blankets made every year, begging and asking,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.23_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.24_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.25.1_0: ‘If a monk who has had a new blanket made must keep it for six years.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.26_0: Whether that blanket has been given away or not, if he has another new blanket made in less than six years, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.27_0: The Buddha has laid down a training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.1_0: On one occasion the nuns approached a monk who was sick
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.2_0: The relatives of that monk sent him a message:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.7_0: “The Buddha has laid down a training rule
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.8_0: that a monk who has had a new blanket made must keep it for six years.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.9_0: Because I’m sick, I’m not able to take my blanket when I travel.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.10_0: And because I’m not comfortable without it,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.12_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.13_0: who gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.14_0: “Monks, I allow you to give a blanket-permission to a sick monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.15_0: And the designation should be given like this.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.16_0: After approaching the Sangha, that monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior monks. He should then squat on his heels, put raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.18_0: I’m not able to take my blanket when I travel.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.19_0: I ask the Sangha for a blanket-permission.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.20_0: And they should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.21_0: And they should ask a third time.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.22_0: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.23_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.24_0: Monk so-and-so is sick. He is unable to take my blanket when he departs.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.25_0: he is asking the Sangha for a blanket-permission.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.26_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give a blanket-permission to monk so-and-so.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.28_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.29_0: Monk so-and-so is sick. He is unable to take my blanket when he departs.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.30_0: he is asking the Sangha for a blanket-permission.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.31_0: The Sangha gives a blanket-permission to monk so-and-so.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.32_0: Any monk who approves of giving a blanket-permission to monk so-and-so should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.33_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.34_0: The Sangha has given a blanket-permission to monk so-and-so.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.35_0: The Sangha agrees and is therefore silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.37_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.38.1_0: ‘If a monk who has had a new blanket made must keep it for six years.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.39_0: Whether that blanket has been given away or not, if he has another new blanket made in less than six years, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.4_0: it is put out in charge of building work.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.6_0: has made or has had made.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.7_0: He should keep it for six years:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.8_0: he should keep it for a minimum of six years.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.11_0: That blanket has been given away:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.14_0: it has not been given to anyone.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.15_0: except if the monks have agreed:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.16_0: If he makes another new blanket, or has one made, unless the monks have agreed, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.17_0: When he gets the sitting-blanket, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.18_0: It should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.19_0: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.21_0: ‘Venerables, this blanket which I had made without having few wishes, is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.22_0: I relinquish them to the Sangha.’ ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.25_0: ‘I give these tonics back to you.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.26.1_0: If she finishes what she began herself, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.27_0: If she has others finish what she began herself, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.28_0: If she finishes herself what was begun by others, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.29_0: If she has others finish what was begun by others, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.31_0: if he makes one after six years;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.32_0: if he makes one after more than six years;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.33_0: if he makes one, or has one made, for the sake of another;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.34_0: if he obtains one made by another that is too large and then uses it;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.35_0: if she makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.39_0: The fourth rule, the training rule on six years, is finished.
